component.name: ahc
component.title: Async HTTP Client (AHC)
component.description: Call external HTTP services using Async Http Client.
component.label: http

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

allowJavaSerializedObject.label: advanced
allowJavaSerializedObject.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

binding.label: advanced
binding.description: To use a custom AhcBinding which allows to control how to bind between AHC and Camel.

clientConfig.label: advanced
clientConfig.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClient to use a custom com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig instance.

headerFilterStrategy.label: filter
headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

sslContextParameters.label: security
sslContextParameters.description: Reference to a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters in the Registry. Note that configuring this option will override any SSL/TLS configuration options provided through the clientConfig option at the endpoint or component level.

useGlobalSslContextParameters.label: security
useGlobalSslContextParameters.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

CamelHttpResponseCode.description: The HTTP response code from the external server. Is 200 for OK.

Content-Length.description: The content length of the response

Content-Encoding.description: The HTTP content encoding. Is set on both the IN and OUT message to provide a content encoding, such as gzip.

Content-Type.description: The HTTP content type. Is set on both the IN and OUT message to provide a content type, such as text/html

CamelHttpUri.description: URI to call. Will override existing URI set directly on the endpoint.

CamelHttpPath.description: Request URI's path, the header will be used to build the request URI with the HTTP_URI. If the path is start with /, http producer will try to find the relative path based on the Exchange.HTTP_BASE_URI header or the exchange.getFromEndpoint().getEndpointUri().

CamelHttpBaseUri.description: The base of the path to append to the URI

CamelHttpQuery.description: Camel 2.11 onwards: URI parameters. Will override existing URI parameters set directly on the endpoint.

httpUri.description: The URI to use such as http://hostname:port/path

bridgeEndpoint.description: If the option is true, then the Exchange.HTTP_URI header is ignored, and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the AhcProducer send all the fault response back.

bufferSize.description: The initial in-memory buffer size used when transferring data between Camel and AHC Client.

connectionClose.label: producer
connectionClose.description: Define if the Connection Close header has to be added to HTTP Request. This parameter is false by default

cookieHandler.label: producer
cookieHandler.description: Configure a cookie handler to maintain a HTTP session

headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

throwExceptionOnFailure.description: Option to disable throwing the AhcOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

transferException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side, and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type (for example using Jetty or Servlet Camel components). On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is, instead of the AhcOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

binding.label: advanced
binding.description: To use a custom AhcBinding which allows to control how to bind between AHC and Camel.

clientConfig.label: advanced
clientConfig.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClient to use a custom com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig instance.

clientConfigOptions.label: advanced
clientConfigOptions.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClientConfig using the key/values from the Map.

clientConfigRealmOptions.label: advanced,security
clientConfigRealmOptions.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClientConfig Realm using the key/values from the Map.

sslContextParameters.label: security
sslContextParameters.description: Reference to a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters in the Registry. This reference overrides any configured SSLContextParameters at the component level. See Using the JSSE Configuration Utility. Note that configuring this option will override any SSL/TLS configuration options provided through the clientConfig option at the endpoint or component level.
